DOC.brief_title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Improve Depression Reduce Cardiovascular Risk Factors
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : Depression risk factor morbidity mortality follow acute MI unstable angina . Two recent study ( sertraline versus placebo sertraline plus cognitive therapy versus usual care ) report modest reduction depression follow acute MI unstable angina , many treat patient remain depressed . Neither study report well medical outcome treat patient . Earlier study find even subclinical depression increase risk mortality cardiac patient . Thus , effective treatment need eliminate depression improve medical outcome patient follow acute MI unstable angina . Omega-3 FAs show augment efficacy antidepressant major depression improve several cardiac risk factor . However , finding show separate line research . No previous study investigate whether omega-3 FAs simultaneously improve depression reduce cardiovascular risk factor post-MI patient . DESIGN NARRATIVE : One hundred fifty patient meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM-IV ) criteria current major depressive episode score 15 high Beck Depression Inventory II history acute MI , unstable angina , cardiac event enrol randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial omega-3 augmentation sertraline . The participant randomly assign receive either sertraline plus omega-3 sertraline plus placebo 10 week . At baseline ten week , subject complete following : 1 ) assessment depression psychosocial functioning ; 2 ) 24-hour electrocardiogram monitor heart rate variability analysis ; 3 ) blood draws measure procoagulant proinflammatory marker , plasma level sertraline omega-3 . If study show omega-3 reduces depression improve cardiovascular disease marker , basis proposing large clinical trial determine whether also improve survival hospitalization acute MI unstable angina .
